Talk_0809:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Ah, Link. Good morning to you.<sp:0:4:0>Class will begin soon. Would you care to
join us again today?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I intend to go over <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>with the
children again today.
Talk_0100:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>History class is ordinarily a bit slow-paced
for the children's taste.<sp:0:4:0>That last lesson may have been the first
time I've seen them enjoying a history
lecture so much.<sp:0:4:0>Our next class is a <clr:0000>home economics<clr:ffff>
lesson. Naturally, you're free to sit in
again if the subject interests you.
Talk_0101: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Well, well! Good morning to you.<sp:0:4:0>Thank you for your contributions.
Talk_0510:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Sadly, the sacred princess was unable to
awaken the holy power within her.<sp:0:4:0>The Divine Beasts were taken over by the
Calamity. Those selected to pilot them
lost their lives in the process.<sp:0:4:0>Worse still, the hero wielding the sword
that seals the darkness was badly hurt.
Just when all seemed lost...<sp:0:4:0>the sacred princess came into her power
and devoted her whole being to keeping
the Calamity at bay for 100 years.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Are you following along so far?<sp:0:4:0>After spending 100 years dormant, the
hero wielding the sword that seals the
darkness awakened, his wounds healed.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>He won back the Divine Beasts with the
help of several allies, including some of
the Champions' descendants.<sp:0:4:0>And in the end, the hero defeated the
Calamity, and the sacred princess stopped
the evil one!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Sorry, I got a little emotional there at the
end. <sp:5:0:0>It's a true story though.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:LaughS_01>But I suppose you're very familiar with
the particulars of that tale. Sorry for
drawing it out.
Talk_0102:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Thank you again for showing the children
the screen depicting the Calamity!
Talk_0511:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>With the wielder of the sword that seals
the darkness and the sacred princess, all
the pieces from the legend were in place.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>But...this time, the Calamity would not be
bested so easily...
Talk_0300:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>My, my, you're early. You're welcome to
sit in today's class as well, naturally.<sp:0:4:0>I'm on my way there now.
Talk_0301:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Today's lesson is home economics.<sp:0:4:0>I'll be lecturing on how to use ingredients
to achieve particular effects so you can
endure whatever comes your way.<sp:0:4:0>If that sounds interesting to you, then
you're welcome to sit in on the class.
Talk_0303:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Well, well, good morning to you.
A shame about this weather, isn't it?
Talk_0500:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>"History is a tale we all tell together. It's
inherited from those who came before us
and passed along to those who follow."<sp:0:4:0>So said Princess Zelda when asked why
she founded this school.<sp:0:4:0>I want the children to make it in this
perilous world and have a bright future.<sp:0:4:0>That's why I put so much effort into
teaching them about history...especially
about <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But teaching is learning, you know, so I
read and reread books every day to make
sure I'm up to the task.
Talk_0305:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Well, well, good evening to you.
A shame about this weather, isn't it?
Talk_0503:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think>The Calamity has visited this land of
Hyrule several times over.<sp:0:4:0>However, 10,000 years ago, <sp:5:0:0>there were
Divine Beasts, built by the Sheikah using
their advanced technology.<sp:0:4:0>Each of them was controlled by a skilled
pilot as well.
Near_0008: Our next lesson is on food.
Talk_0700:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Oh, good evening. Don't mind me, please.<sp:0:4:0>Once I got to contemplating how to 
make <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>for the children,
I found myself unable to sleep...
Talk_0504:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:TalkPositive_01>With the sword that seals the darkness
and the power of the sacred princess, the
Ancient Hero stopped the Calamity.<sp:0:4:0>For a long while after that, the lands of
Hyrule knew peace.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Sad_00>But the time when the people forgot about
the Calamity was the moment it returned
to menace them once more...
Talk_0701:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The Goron spice and Hylian rice are easy
enough. It's getting some <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>
that may prove difficult.<sp:0:4:0>I'm sure I heard there was some to be had
in the north at <clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff> in Akkala.
Talk_0505:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Tomorrow's lesson is on home economics.<sp:0:4:0>I have a lecture planned about unique
dishes, so if that interests you, you're
welcome to stop by and sit in!
Talk_0914:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The other day, I told the class that the
only use for monster parts is to brew
medicine.<sp:0:4:0>Today's lesson about <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>
may have been confusing for them.<sp:0:4:0>I'm sure they would understand if they
could try <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>for themselves.
Talk_1110:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>C-class! Come and see here. This curry
was prepared using monster extract.
Talk_0506:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Sorry for rambling on so long. I expect
you know this story quite well already.
Talk_0703:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_01>Wait... Even half asleep, I'd recognize
that scent. Did you prepare some
<clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>?
Talk_0900:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Hm, this just isn't working.<sp:0:4:0>If only I had <clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>, I could prove 
that <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff> can, in fact, be used
to prepare meals.
Talk_1111:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:TalkPositive_00>Thank you so much.<sp:0:4:0>See those solemn expressions on their
faces? The children have matured a bit
with today's lesson.<sp:0:4:0>You might not think yourself a teacher,
Link, but you've already taught them
a great deal.
Talk_1112:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Ah...my apologies.<sp:0:4:0>I've been thinking so much about <clr:0000>monster<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>curry <clr:ffff>that I can practically smell it.
Talk_0508:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Each night before I turn in, I think about 
Hyrule's history with the Calamity.<sp:0:4:0>We are only here today because of the
history our predecessors built, so there's
a big responsibility to learn it.
Talk_0705:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_00>If you wouldn't mind, could you give that
curry to the children in my next <clr:0000>class<clr:ffff>?
Talk_1113:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>You're a hit with the students too. You've
earned the right to use the <clr:0000>school's field<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>That's the one <clr:0000>behind the schoolyard<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>Space is limited, so you can't plant an
entire farm back there, but use what we
have to cultivate whatever you'd like!<sp:0:4:0><clr:0000>Uma <clr:ffff>typically tends the field. Why don't
you talk to her to get things set up?
Talk_0509:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>This all happened about 100 years ago.<sp:5:0:0>
It began with an oracle prophesying the 
Calamity's return.<sp:0:4:0>The royal family took their cues from the
legends of the past. <sp:5:0:0>They found and
excavated the Divine Beasts.<sp:0:4:0>Skilled members of the Rito, Goron, Zora,
and Gerudo peoples were selected to pilot
them. They were called the Champions.
Talk_1114:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0701>Next time, I'm planning a test that will cover
everything we've studied up to now.<sp:0:4:0>You're welcome to sit in anytime. I hope you'll stay
involved with our classes here!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_1100:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>How am I going to get through to them?<sp:5:1:0>
Mmmyes? <sp:5:0:0>That spicy scent is familiar.
Talk_0905:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The other day, I told the class that
the only use for monster parts is to
brew medicine.<sp:0:4:0>Today's lesson about <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>
may have been confusing for them.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I wish I could make some real <clr:0000>monster
curry<clr:ffff> with Goron spice, Hylian rice, and
<clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>Eating is believing, after all.<sp:0:4:0>Alas, right now I'm out of <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I'm told that it can be had in <clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff>,
up north in Akkala.
Talk_1102: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>This is monster curry! The genuine article!
Talk_1103:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>The color looks a little off... Oh, but it
tastes better than I expected.
Talk_1104:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Greeting_00>Whoa, you're right! It doesn't have that
monster musk I was worried about.
Talk_1105:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>So if you extract something special from
monsters, you can use that for cooking?
Talk_1107:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Work_00>That's right, everyone.<sp:0:4:0>Ordinarily, monster parts are only to be
used in medicine. But <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>
can be used in meals as well.<sp:0:4:0>I'm so happy that my lesson on the
subject has finally sunk in!
Talk_0200:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Notice_00>Yes, yes, what is it?<sp:0:4:0>Oh! Are you eager for the <clr:0000>home
economics <clr:ffff>class to start?<sp:0:4:0>Well, you've come just a bit too early.
Would you mind waiting a little longer?
Talk_0201:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Notice_00>Ah, are you eager for the <clr:0000>home economics<clr:ffff>
class to start?<sp:0:4:0>Well, you've come just a bit too early.
Would you mind waiting a little longer?
Talk_0610:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>Hey, hey, settle down, children...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>Hm, this lesson may be too advanced.<sp:0:4:0>In fact, combining monster extract,
Goron spice, and Hylian rice makes
<clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>But judging from your skeptical faces,
you won't believe me unless I can put
a dish of it in front of you.<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>I'd love to make some <clr:0000>curry <clr:ffff>for them, but I don't 
have any <clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>I'm told that it can be had in <clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff>, up north
in Akkala...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_0202:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Well, well... <sp:5:0:0>What do you think? Care to
sit for class while taking shelter from
the rain?
Talk_0400:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Today's home economics class may have
been a bit too difficult.<sp:0:4:0>But in a world as dangerous as ours, we
must raise our children to understand the
power to be found in ingredients.<sp:0:4:0>Only then can they prepare dishes to
help them handle whatever comes
their way.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I think I'll review my syllabus so far once
I've finished cleaning up here.<sp:0:4:0>To teach is to learn, after all.
Talk_0612:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Mr. Symin, you're the one who taught us
that monster parts should only be used
for medicine!
Talk_0810:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Would you care to join us again today?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I intend to go over <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>with the
children again today.
Talk_0613:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's time to continue our lesson on home
economics.<sp:0:4:0>If you take Goron spice, Hylian rice...<sp:5:0:0>and
mix in...<sp:5:1:0><clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>, what do you get?
Talk_0403:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Well, well, good afternoon to you.
A shame about this weather, isn't it?
Talk_0600:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Today's lecture is on home economics.
Food is essential for our survival.<sp:0:4:0>A keen culinary sense can help you stay
alive in this perilous world.<sp:0:4:0>I'd like to put a question to you all:<sp:0:4:0>What dish do you get by mixing Goron 
spice with Hylian rice and raw meat?
Talk_1023:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Ah, Link. Good day to you.<sp:0:4:0>It would be wonderful if you could assist
me with my study of <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>But right now I'm stewing over how to
get the children to try <clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0601:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>But the only other thing in it is <clr:0000>raw meat<clr:ffff>,
right? So obviously...
Talk_0602:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01><clr:0000>Goron spice<clr:ffff> is<clr:0000> <clr:ffff>the hot stuff they sell in
Goron City in the northeast, right?
Talk_0603:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>If it's got <clr:0000>Goron spice<clr:ffff> in it, the answer
can't be anything but curry.
Talk_0800:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Ah, Link. Good morning to you.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>That lesson about <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>may have
been too advanced for my students.<sp:0:4:0>But I'd like to figure out some way to help
them understand for next time...
Talk_1012:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>I'm not much good at history, but you
made it fun, Mr. Link!
Talk_0605:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Yes, that's correct. That one might have
been on the simple side for all of you.
How about this one, then?<sp:0:4:0>Take Goron spice, Hylian rice...<sp:5:0:0>and mix
in...<sp:5:1:0><clr:0000>monster extract<clr:ffff>. What do you
get then?
Talk_0606:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Work_01>Yeah! If you try to cook with monster
parts, it's a disaster every time!
Talk_1014:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>I pretty much think of you as my teacher
already anyway...
Talk_1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Ah, Link. Good evening to you.<sp:0:4:0>It would be wonderful if you could assist
me with my study of <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>But right now I'm stewing over how to
get the children to try <clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>.
Talk_1015:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Thanks, Mr. Link! I can't wait for our
next lesson with you!
Talk_0608:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Um, aren't monster parts only used
for medicines?
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Certainly, it would be wonderful if you
could assist me with my study of the
<clr:0000>Calamity<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>But right now I'm stewing over how to
get the children to try <clr:0000>monster curry<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0609:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>No one would eat curry made with
monster stuff! I call trick question!
Talk_0807:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>If you wouldn't mind, could you give that
curry to the children in my class?
Talk_0808:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That lesson about <clr:0000>monster curry <clr:ffff>may have
been too advanced for my students.<sp:0:4:0>But I'd like to figure out some way to help
them understand for next time...
